intro: Asplenium anteninaense, commonly known as the Antenina Island maidenhair fern, is a species of fern native to the island of Antenina in the Philippines. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, finely serrated margin. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest undergrowth or on rocky surfaces. Its spores are released from small, fleshy, club-shaped sporangia located on the underside of the fronds. Asplenium anteninaense is notable for its ornamental value and is of interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and unique morphology.
